intro: Boehmeria malabarica var. leioclada, commonly known as Malabar flax, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle plants, and is characterized by its fibrous, silky leaves. The plant is known for its soft, hairy foliage and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its fibrous properties, it has been historically used for textile production and traditional crafts.
